title.narrative: OUTPUT 12: WATER SUPPLY & QUALITY

description.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to deliver safe and sustainable drinking water services to communities, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children and their families have access to affordable and safe drinking water, supported by more efficient national strategies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to deliver safe and sustainable drinking water services to communities

description.narrative: The National Water Policy 2007 has been reviewed, pending promulgation from Parliament.; With UNICEF direct support, a total of 6,482 people (about 1,500 children) in the Northern Region have gained access to safe, sustainable water supply through the modelling of utility-based service management and Water Safety Plan (WSP) approaches. Ongoing provision of water supply services to about 50,000 people in low-income urban areas in the framework of COVID 19 response.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:16/12/2021

actual.value: 2021:Evaluation of WSP pilots and initial implementation in progress

title.narrative: Recommendations from a study to assess urban water supply services are endorsed by MSWR(52817)

actual.value: 2020:Draft Research Report is under review by government and other stakeholders for finalization and validation
